reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When I first saw the pictures of the Inn and it's rooms on their website, I immediately thought of New Orleans' French Quarter. It was so romantic looking. Our room was beautiful, with a canopy bed, fireplace and French doors opening onto a terrace overlooking a tree lined street. Perfect way to start our holiday!
reviews.title: Victoria Court, a bit of the French Quarter in Sydney

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was well located within walking distance of everything, yet set away from all the noice of the main streets. All sorts of publlic transportation was just a block or so away. The staff was very pleasant and very gracious in helping us with anything we needed. I would definitely recommend it.
reviews.title: Great website...poor place!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Jonini
reviews.title: Very disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We decided to spend our honey moon in Australia and organize all by ourselves as we do not like impersonal places. and we love to discover tiny, little B&B that would help us to get in contact with the place we are visiting..searching on internet we were impressed by the images of the website and we hurried up to book a room, we phoned direclty to the owner and pointed out that it was our Honey moon asking to have a good room....the expectations were high...The room assigned was at the first floor, but it was not bright...and it was really far from the one displayed on the website...it was damp and the bathroom just reminded me of the one we found in a barren moor in the andesite a couple of years before. The breakfast was poor and essential...Considering that it took almost 30 hours to get from Italy to Sydney we did not have the strenght to complain, but the first impact was really bad!! Luckily it was in a strategic position (the one and only positive aspect)!!! i would not reccomend it to anyone who is looking for a nice place...at least at the price they sell the rooms!!!!
reviews.title: Lovely!

likes.disliked: — Some of the furnishings inside the room were a bit dated

reviews.text: We contacted Victoria Court Hotel directly to book a room. Well aware of the experience of some of the travellers posted on this website, we requested the hotel management to give us a room in the upper floor. So when we arrived we were quite surprised when we were given a room on the ground floor without informing us.
reviews.title: Great Small Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 6 nights in Feb 2007. Our Economy Double room was the size of a shoebox. The breakfast was average and I found two cockroaches in our room.
reviews.title: Disappointed....cockroaches
Not impressed
reviews.text: On the plus side the location was very good...although very close to the main red light area. The area was safe though. Walkable to Sydney city centre and a 1 min walk to Kingscross subway. The hotel was expensive for what we got. There are some 4* Hostels right in the city centre now which offer excellent accomodation for very reasonable prices. Will go there next time.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Chose this hotel after being recommended somewhere else.My first mistake.
reviews.title: Great Stay

likes.disliked: — Ask for a Premium or Luxury room

reviews.title: Nice Little Hotel
reviews.text: Had a premium room and wonder where the premium came into it..
The room was very tired and in need of renovation.
reviews.title: Great location - disappointing hotel
Disappointing...would not recommend
reviews.text: Stayed for 3 nights. Location a bit out of the way but public transport was good. Our room was a bit shabby, stained walls etc, TINY bathroom - not enough room to dry off after shower - and could have been cleaner. Breakfast was awful, very cheap quality and after the first morning we had to go out for breakfast. Plus points - manager was very friendly and helpful, the dining area was nice, but this should apply to all rooms too. Looking at other reviews it seems that some rooms are better than others - surely staying here should not be a lottery?

Great location with lots of good restarants in the neighbourhood. Very quiet in an old victorian building. Very friendly and helpful staff; nothing is too much. Breakfast is in teh conservatory; very charming. Have been there two times so far and had a good time on both occasions. The italian restaurant accross the street is a real treat. Good food and most beautiful views over the entire skyline.
reviews.title: Little oasis in a big city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked this hotel over the internet at the last minute and had a great stay. Nice room with comfortable bed - nice people. Rudy the manager was particularly helpful with booking tours and giving information. Nothing was too much for him. We enjoyed having breakfast in the courtyard with the fountain. Great location for sightseeing and good restaurants in the area, yet quiet to get good sleep. Highly recommended. We wish that we could have stayed longer; but we will be back. Thank you.
reviews.title: Would have loved to stay longer

likes.liked: — Charming Hotel, central loctation, friendly people

reviews.text: Penny Rist
reviews.title: Would not go again

reviews.text: Coral Gables, Florida
reviews.title: The Victoria Court Hotel - a charming B&B

reviews.text: Not a lot to complain about really - inexpensive, superb location very close to station, air-conditioned rooms, lovely building and al fresco breakfast included in price! Only two minor gripes - we got quite a small room and the prices quoted on their website exclude Goods and Services Tax, a 10% tax that everyone has to pay. Although it's possible for non-Australians to get GST refunded on goods above $300, that doesn't apply to services. You've got a great hotel guys, worth $165 per night of anyone's money, so why not be honest about your prices?
reviews.title: Very nice
not bad
reviews.text: just stayed at the Victoria on our first visit to Sydney.

reviews.title: Lovely Hotel
reviews.text: spent 4 nights in the top room.this is a cheap room/separate bathroom on another floor[OWN].
price inc continental breakfast,help yourself.
reviews.title: Sting in the tail!
Nice hotel but overpriced
reviews.text: room was tiny but clean,had air-con & fan.
